alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 8:40PM CST until March 09 at 5:00AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Iowa... Wapsipinicon River near De Witt 4S affecting Clinton and Scott Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois... Cedar River near Conesville affecting Louisa and Muscatine Counties. Rock River near Joslin affecting Rock Island, Whiteside and Henry IL Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wapsipinicon River near De Witt 4S. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, Moderate Flood Stage. Water affects homes along old U.S. Highway 61. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CST Friday the stage was 11.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The river is currently rising to a second crest. - Forecast...The river will rise to 11.7 feet early Sunday morning and then slowly fall. It will fall below flood stage late Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning.
